background: An office supply company makes two types of printers: color printers and black and white printers.

parameters.definition: Maximum number of color printers that can be produced per day
Maximum number of black and white printers that can be produced per day
Maximum number of printers that the paper tray installing machine can equip per day
Profit generated per black and white printer

constraint.description: Number of color printers is an integer
Number of black and white printers is an integer
constraint.code:
# The variable BlackWhitePrinters is already defined as an integer; no need to change its integrality
# Set lower and upper bounds for BlackWhitePrinters
model.addConstr(BlackWhitePrinters >= 0, name="min_bw_printers")
model.addConstr(BlackWhitePrinters <= MaxBW, name="max_bw_printers")

constraint.description: Number of color printers is non-negative
constraint.code:
# Constraint: Number of color printers is non-negative
model.addConstr(ColorPrinters >= 0, name="non_negative_color_printers")

constraint.description: Number of black and white printers is non-negative
constraint.code:
# Ensure the number of black and white printers is non-negative
model.addConstr(BlackWhitePrinters >= 0, name="non_negative_black_white_printers")

constraint.description: The company can make at most MaxColor color printers per day
constraint.code:
# Add maximum color printer production constraint
model.addConstr(ColorPrinters <= MaxColor, name="max_color_printers_constraint")

constraint.description: The company can make at most MaxBW black and white printers per day
constraint.code:
# Add constraint for the maximum number of black and white printers produced per day
model.addConstr(BlackWhitePrinters <= MaxBW, name="max_black_white_printers")

constraint.description: The company can make at most a total of MaxTotal printers per day
constraint.code:
# Add a constraint for the maximum total number of printers produced per day
model.addConstr(ColorPrinters + BlackWhitePrinters <= MaxTotal, name="MaxTotalPrinters")

constraint.description: The number of color printers produced per day cannot exceed the maximum production capacity for color printers
constraint.code:
# Add constraint for maximum production capacity of color printers
model.addConstr(ColorPrinters <= MaxColor, name="max_color_capacity")

constraint.description: The number of black and white printers produced per day cannot exceed the maximum production capacity for black and white printers
constraint.code:
# Add constraint for maximum production capacity of black and white printers
model.addConstr(BlackWhitePrinters <= MaxBW, name="max_bw_production_capacity")

constraint.description: The total number of printers produced per day cannot exceed the maximum number of printers that the paper tray installing machine can equip per day
constraint.code:
# Add printer production capacity constraint
model.addConstr(ColorPrinters + BlackWhitePrinters <= MaxTotal, name="production_capacity")

variables.definition: Number of color printers produced per day
Number of black and white printers produced per day

objective.description: Maximize the company's profit, which is ProfitColor per color printer plus ProfitBW per black and white printer.
objective.code:
# Define the objective function
model.setObjective(ProfitColor * ColorPrinters + ProfitBW * BlackWhitePrinters, gp.GRB.MAXIMIZE)

code:
import json
import numpy as np
import math

import gurobipy as gp

 # Define model
model = gp.Model('model')

with open("data/nl4opt/prob_1/data.json", "r") as f:
    data = json.load(f)


MaxColor = data["MaxColor"] # scalar parameter
MaxBW = data["MaxBW"] # scalar parameter
MaxTotal = data["MaxTotal"] # scalar parameter
ProfitColor = data["ProfitColor"] # scalar parameter
ProfitBW = data["ProfitBW"] # scalar parameter
ColorPrinters = model.addVar(vtype=gp.GRB.INTEGER, name="ColorPrinters")
BlackWhitePrinters = model.addVar(vtype=gp.GRB.INTEGER, name="BlackWhitePrinters")



# The variable BlackWhitePrinters is already defined as an integer; no need to change its integrality
# Set lower and upper bounds for BlackWhitePrinters
model.addConstr(BlackWhitePrinters >= 0, name="min_bw_printers")
model.addConstr(BlackWhitePrinters <= MaxBW, name="max_bw_printers")

# Constraint: Number of color printers is non-negative
model.addConstr(ColorPrinters >= 0, name="non_negative_color_printers")

# Ensure the number of black and white printers is non-negative
model.addConstr(BlackWhitePrinters >= 0, name="non_negative_black_white_printers")

# Add maximum color printer production constraint
model.addConstr(ColorPrinters <= MaxColor, name="max_color_printers_constraint")

# Add constraint for the maximum number of black and white printers produced per day
model.addConstr(BlackWhitePrinters <= MaxBW, name="max_black_white_printers")

# Add a constraint for the maximum total number of printers produced per day
model.addConstr(ColorPrinters + BlackWhitePrinters <= MaxTotal, name="MaxTotalPrinters")

# Add constraint for maximum production capacity of color printers
model.addConstr(ColorPrinters <= MaxColor, name="max_color_capacity")

# Add constraint for maximum production capacity of black and white printers
model.addConstr(BlackWhitePrinters <= MaxBW, name="max_bw_production_capacity")

# Add printer production capacity constraint
model.addConstr(ColorPrinters + BlackWhitePrinters <= MaxTotal, name="production_capacity")

# Define the objective function
model.setObjective(ProfitColor * ColorPrinters + ProfitBW * BlackWhitePrinters, gp.GRB.MAXIMIZE)

# Optimize model
model.optimize()



# Get model status
status = model.status

obj_val = None
# check whether the model is infeasible, has infinite solutions, or has an optimal solution
if status == gp.GRB.INFEASIBLE:
    obj_val = "infeasible"
elif status == gp.GRB.INF_OR_UNBD:
    obj_val = "infeasible or unbounded"
elif status == gp.GRB.UNBOUNDED:
    obj_val = "unbounded"
elif status == gp.GRB.OPTIMAL:
    obj_val = model.objVal
